## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`hosts`](#hosts): Manage /etc/hosts entries

## Classes

### <a name="hosts"></a>`hosts`

Manage /etc/hosts entries

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `hosts` class:

* [`entries`](#-hosts--entries)
* [`default_entries`](#-hosts--default_entries)
* [`purge`](#-hosts--purge)
* [`manage_fqdn`](#-hosts--manage_fqdn)

##### <a name="-hosts--entries"></a>`entries`

Data type: `Hash[String[1], Hash[String[1], Any]]`

A hash of hosts entries to manage

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-hosts--default_entries"></a>`default_entries`

Data type: `Hash[String[1], Hash[String[1], Any]]`

A hash of hosts entries to manage by default

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-hosts--purge"></a>`purge`

Data type: `Boolean`

unmanaged host resources

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-hosts--manage_fqdn"></a>`manage_fqdn`

Data type: `Boolean`

manage the fqdn entry

Default value: `true`
